website_summaries.verdict: The Microsoft Explorer Mouse deserves your attention for its BlueTrack sensor technology that lets you use it on surfaces where other mice fail. Laptop owners, or anyone else who uses a nondeskbound computer, will benefit from Microsoft's innovative new technology.
pros: New BlueTrack mouse sensor works on almost any surface

customer_reviews.title: I've been robbed
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Microsoft Explorer Mouse. The battery does not work, it is rechargeable but does not charge. They sent me the wrong usb receiver. I put another battery to the mouse, but the mouse turns on but it does not work. I've been robbed
customer_reviews.author: Diego Chacon Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, durable but poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for over 8 years. My favorite mouse, and never purchased another mouse. Top quality and everything, i just wished the batter lasted a little longer. 5/5 definitely recommended
customer_reviews.author: dogangulen

customer_reviews.title: Haven't found a flat surface it won't work on.
customer_reviews.text: As the title suggests this mouse works everywhere (couch cushions, shag carpet, shiny linoleum and metal). It feels great in the hand, as long as you buy the correct handedness because they are ergonomic. The battery lasts a long, it charges quickly, and the charging pad is small but effective. I like the blue light on it, but it's not overdone because it only illuminates when you pull it out of sleep mode. I wish there was a button to change the scroll wheel between smooth and "clicky" but the extra buttons by the side are easy to map, and nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: JRC

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This mouse worked great for 2 months then wouldn't recharge the battery. thought it might be the battery so I bought a rechargeable battery pack but it wouldn't charge any of those up either. the batteries themselves got hot, the charging unit got hot at the plug. but the batteries remained dead. I thought for sure because the batteries got warm/hot that they were getting current. so my original thought was that the battery that came with the mouse was old and lostthe ability to hold a charge. so I bought a 4 pack of NIMH rechargeables. they got warm but wouldn't hold a charge either.
customer_reviews.author: Skairkrow

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mouse for a desktop PC.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is shaped to a right handed contour, so if you're looking for an ambidextrous or left handed mouse, this isn't for you. The BlueTrack technology works just like it's supposed to. You can use this mouse on any surface except clear glass and it functions perfectly. The addition of the extra two side buttons is great for any sort of photo or video editing, and is a nice feature for gamers who don't want to invest $100 in a mouse. The only downside is the scroll wheel. It doesn't click as you scroll, which makes over scrolling a hassle when you're getting used to the mouse, but you get used to it with regular use.
customer_reviews.author: enigmaDAEDAL

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Still use this mouse, battery life is OK, but still for 8 year it has been the best
customer_reviews.author: Mikeiza

customer_reviews.title: OK, but nothing to write home about
customer_reviews.text: The mouse's basic functioning is fine - its not especially quick or accurate. The ergonomics don't really suit my large hand. In spite of most reviews it feels too small for me and inclines too steeping in the front. This causes the mouse wheel and buttons to be at too uncomfortable an angle for me. Add to that the ridiculously LOUD clicking when activating the front buttons and I'm not impressed. The old Intellimouse Explorer 2.0 it replaced was much more comfortable, precise and quieter in use. Pretty sad when they can't improve on a design from 7 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Morse

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Wireless Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I am not gonna get into too much detail with the product, what can I say? It does what its supposed to do, and at a great price. The battery life isn't too bad, I've owned this for almost a week without charging it and I am on the computer A LOT. Reviewers that state that this doesn't hold a charge, I have to disagree. I've owned wireless mouses in the past that were HORRIBLE on battery life and this isn't one of them. If you want the greatest mouse in the whole entire world buy something more expensive. For a basic no frills mouse, buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica LeRoy

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse
customer_reviews.text: I must admit when I received this mouse I thought wow its big and heavy , But as I started to use it I instantly fell in love with it. I have big hands and it is a perfect fit plus I like the 5 button config. I am not sure about the battery life as of yet but time will tell. For now I am glad I bought this mouse , for me it seems a perfect fit , Oh and I love the blue halo it puts out . I also love the smooth action of the scroll wheel with no clicks . I would highly recommend this mouse for sure ................
customer_reviews.author: Solon Moore

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Product
customer_reviews.text: Been using this product for over a year and I can say simply that the product works. works on most surfaces as described and battery life too is very good. I can use a full charge for weeks. works with all my pc games esp. COD: Modern Warfare 3. The only down side is the size of the receiver. I think they could have made it a little smaller. Also the scrolling wheel has been silent since the first day I got it. I simply LOVE this product. Thanks MICROSOFT
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Esco

customer_reviews.title: a great mouse, do they still make this anymore?
customer_reviews.text: bluetrack is a great technology. the mouse is truly more responsive than the traditional red laser ones. battery life is decent, so i always have a secodn rechargeable battery lying around. I often forget to dock it but that seems to work well (when i remember to do so). i mostly enjoy the ergo feel of this mouse, allowing me to work for hours without hand pains. mouse wheel scrolls smoothly and there are some extra buttons with features like zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Samwize the brave

customer_reviews.title: Battery recharging laser mouse
customer_reviews.text: Just love this mouse. Its the best one I have every owned. I like it because you never have to buy batteries, at least for a long time, you just recharge the ones that are in it. It seems to work on any surface. The only thing that I found a problem is that you have to charge the batteries about once a week. But this is not that hard because the mouse sits on a charging base that charges the batteries and charges them up real fast. I am thinking about buying another one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: P. B.

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize this was meant to be "portable", for that, it's pretty large to want to carry around in a laptop bag, bug I guess you could. It comes with a wall-powered charger to rest the mouse on, but a USB key for wireless transmission...would have preferred that the charger was usb-powered so it could act as a receiver/charger. Great mouse, love the ergonomics, but I probably would look for a mouse with a usb receiver/charger before I bought another one of these things.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have 3 of them...
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse! I love it so much that I own 3 of them--a pair in use and a spare for when one dies. The size is perfect for me--I hate when I get hand cramping from using a too-small mouse for several hours a day---and a battery lasts for AGES in this mouse. Works smoothly on virtually any surface and at a good distance from the USB wireless adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Hillbillie

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Love this mouse. Fits just right in my hand. I've tried quite a few different brands and styles and they all caused pain in my hand but this one is perfectly shaped. The pain went away quickly and stayed away ever since. This is my 3rd or 4th one. I always have a spare becasue they do die after so many recharges but it takes years (for example, I bought this one as a spare and haven't used it yet).
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: My all time favorite mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't read the description well enough and the one I purchased had a international plug. This was purchased to replace my old one that finally died but lucky for me I was able to use this mouse with my old charger. Win/Win and I got the mouse my husband is accustomed to using.
customer_reviews.author: buttons

customer_reviews.title: microsoft explorer mouse
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars, the Microsoft Explorer mouse performs as advertised, it just takes a little getting used to, and I agree with some of the other reviews it's a little too large size wise, battery life seems to be very good, sometimes I forget to put it on the charger overnight and it still works all the next day, I think probably some people would be more comfortable with the smaller one, also after I received this I found Sam's Club has them in stock.
customer_reviews.author: Jerold L. Davids

customer_reviews.title: liked it
customer_reviews.text: has good range and still use it. Remember Always check your bank statement. Amazon got me for $80.00 gift card i didn't order and never made good on it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G

customer_reviews.title: Works with Windows 7
customer_reviews.text: After reading several reviews about how this mouse didn't work with Windows 7, I was a little hesitant to get it. I decided to give it a try anyway. All I did was plug in the receiver, and the OS recognized it and installed all the drivers. I didn't bother installing anything from the CD. I did have older Microsoft IntelliPoint mouse drivers on my machine, so that may have aided in the ease of my installation. The main point is that this mouse does work with Windows 7. Rating as 5 stars for now as it seems to work perfectly out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: worst mouse i've ever had
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS MOUSE! This is the worst rechargeable mouse ever, because you can put it on the charger all night, and then start using it and it will blink red that it needs to be charged. I actually bought 1 for home and work, and thought maybe it was just the work one that did this, nope, happens on both of them, and it's random. Apparently this unit won't charge until it's out of juice, so get ready if you buy it to have this happen at the worst times.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and very convenient
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband because he didn't like using the mouse on his laptop, especially when it was connected to his larger monitor. He asked me to find him a wireless mouse that didn't require batteries. I found this one and he has been very happy with it. It was easy to set up and keeps a charge for quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: C. Pascua

customer_reviews.title: Compares to High end mice!
customer_reviews.text: Love the mouse and will be ordering more. It have the accuracy and general feel of my $90 G9 mouse and that is saying a lot! Battery life is great and well above average, Range just freaking rocks! I get 30+ feet without a hic-up, If you need a wireless mouse for a media PC hooked to the TV then this is what you want. On a side note: Don't install the software that comes with it because it will annoy you and is not needed. :P
customer_reviews.author: Alan K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mouse for my husband, since previous reviewers said it was larger than most, and this was perfect for a mans larger hand. He's very pleased with the look and feel, and especially that it's rechargeable. It's very responsive and holds a charge for weeks! The charger base is really tiny, so doesn't take up much space on the desktop at all, which is another plus. Overall, we're very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jowhit67

customer_reviews.title: Worst mouse I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: To put it simply it has a defect where the battery will not stay seated in the battery case. Microsoft should recall this mouse and replace it. I understand it is a cheap item, but it is an embarassment for a Company that has been making very nice software and hardware lately. I am throwing mine away right now (3 months old) and buying a new mouse. Probably a Logitech (fool me once and all that...)
customer_reviews.author: Adam Missner

customer_reviews.title: good mouse
customer_reviews.text: pretty good mouse...i like how you can configure all the buttons globally as well as for individual programs. I also liked the fact that amazon includes a battery with the product; though it's generic,you can always use your own AA rechargeable battery instead. The middle wheel scrolls vertically and horizontally, however the wheel click isn't as sensitive as i would have liked. a minor annoyance at the most....
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed using this mouse. It offers great functionality at a affordable price. The range is impeccable; I could sit in my bed and 5 feet away from my desk and still be able to control my laptop with ease. The tracking is also great--I could use the mouse on my carpet. My only complaint is that it is a little big and heavy,.
customer_reviews.author: Huong X. Vu

customer_reviews.title: Been a problem since day one...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse to replace a another Microsoft mouse on which ruberized hand grip was deteriorating. This mouse goes into nervious breakdown from time to time. I'm running Windows 7 Home Professional 64 bit and have down loaded every known driver for theis mouse and yet occasionally it gets very jerky. Whe you try to place it on an object it jumps about an inch. I can plug up any other mouse I have and they all work perfectly. I would never purchase this mouse again..
customer_reviews.author: Hoyt Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Comfy mouse, glitchy connection
customer_reviews.text: A super comfy mouse. Only flaw is that it started to cut in and out. I would be connected just fine and in the middle of moving the mouse, it would lose connection. This was very annoying to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Meng Lucky Xiong

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good wireless mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse does what I need it to: mouses over all sorts of surfaces, battery life is long enough (just remember to charge it!) and it is customizable via both the Mac OS and Microsoft's utility. This is the only complaint that I have: the Mac OS takes priority over the Microsoft software-had to track down why my right click button wasn't performing correctly and found the problem in Expose'. Otherwise, this mouse is great.
customer_reviews.author: D. Shipley

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft 2.4GHz Wireless BlueTrack Technology Laser Explorer Mouse with
customer_reviews.text: I'm STILL using this item and I purchased it AGES ago. This is an AWESOME mouse and my favorite part is that I don't have to keep buying BATTERIES! I just recharge it when the right light starts flashing (usually right before I go to bed I will put it on the charger.) I can get several days out of a charged mouse. Highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Terrae

customer_reviews.title: TLDR: It's good,
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse on December 5, 2011. This mouse has clicked its way though countless over 5,000 matches in World of Tanks, a hundred hours of Skyrim and Mass Effect 2 and 3 and many other games. Its been dropped many times, occasionally kicked as it fell and has been used so often there is a spot where my thumb rests on the little nook on the left side of the mouse. It finally stopped responding July 19th, 2014. the usb dongle shows up in the hardware tab, but the mouse itself sits there with it's blue laser shining but nothing happening. This mouse is a good mouse, may it also be good for you.
customer_reviews.author: Leonel Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Greatest mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is very comfortable to use, it responds well to movement with no problems on any surface that I have tried to use it on. I like the magnify button that instantly turns your cursor into a magnifier. I have never had it lose its connection to the computer. I had to buy the second one after my wife used it, she said she had to have one for her computer. Also if you forget to charge it just a few minutes on the charger puts it back in operation.
customer_reviews.author: Big Bill

customer_reviews.title: wish there was an off button
customer_reviews.text: I like the mouse pretty good so far ! just wish it had an off button to save some energy. the only way to turn it off is to plug the USB adaptor back in the mouse. also this is a full size mouse quite big. I do like the neat charging base. As for the blue light have not figured it out yet not sure when it turns on or off !
customer_reviews.author: VKB

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable in hand
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for some time now and am very pleased with its operation. Software included is for up to Vista but I am using it on 7. Updated software is available from Microsoft and easily downloaded. The only thing that needed getting used to was the scroll wheel which has no indexing and rolls with ease. I am very happy with the operation and feel of this product.
customer_reviews.author: onefungi

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Well, this is one mouse I haven't been able to catch in a trap. This was purchased for my son and I can't get it out of his grips for me to even try. We bought it for his laptop and he is wild about it. I can only say that it lights up, looks cool and has its own recharger, no more dying batteries. Guess I need to purchase one for my laptop too.
customer_reviews.author: TheGambler

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Explorer Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I am able to use the mouse without a mouse pad, which was my objective. It last quite a while between charges. Its a lot fatter then any other mouse I have ever seen or used. I have a Wireless Optical Mouse which is much smaller, uses AA batteries and is 1/2 the price, except it skips sometimes without a mouse pad and the Explorer does not.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy D.

customer_reviews.title: This is the best moue I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: This is the best moue I've ever purchased. Matches perfect with my metal aluminum pad. Would definitely purchase again or recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David Silvas

customer_reviews.title: Same Old Wireless Technology
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a number of wireless keyboards and mice over the years and have always found the mice to not work consistently and this mouse is no exception. Most of the time it works fine but every now and then I have to re-seat the battery to initiate the connection between the mouse and the wireless receiver. The battery seems to wear down a little fast and I have to keep a wired mouse in my drawer which I have had to use a couple of times. The scroll wheel is smooth when it is rolled and doesn't click with each small scroll which is not typical of most mice and which I am having trouble getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ward

customer_reviews.title: Best Mouse I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse a few months ago and have been using it ever since with my laptop. I absolutely love it. Yes, the mouse is bigger than some, but the design actually fits my hand perfectly, with optimal resting positions for 3 fingers and your thumb. And the BlueTrack technology is amazing. I literally used it all over my house, on everything I could try, and it worked everywhere. Walls, carpet, ceiling, my pants leg, you name it. Overall I am extremely satisfied with the product as a whole, and my onyl wish is that Microsoft would update their drivers so scrolling in iTunes wouldn't be an issue anymore! (Not limited to this mouse btw)
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Haney

customer_reviews.title: Works on everything save glass
customer_reviews.text: Works great nearly perfect model expect I just wish you could charge it while using it. Either way i'm very happy with my purchase and have found this mouse to work perfectly on almost any surface. The charge lasts well and when it does start to run out a couple minutes on its charger and it works for quite a while until that charge runs out. Would recommend to buy, i ended up buying another for my mother.
customer_reviews.author: Benbbest

customer_reviews.title: The mouse is great, as long as your battery is full
customer_reviews.text: First, expect NOTHING from the recharging base. It crapped out on the mouse I bought for my girlfriend and I within three months each, failing to charge the included batteries and ruining our others. I now just use standard AA's, but when battery charge falls below ~30%, the mouse starts freezing and skipping. All in all, you can probably do better for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Battery life and glitchiness issues.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, ergonomic, but the battery life isn't great, and when the charge starts getting low, it won't run smoothly, jumps around a lot and that sucks if you're trying to play a game. The battery is replaceable, and I might have to try that, but it's been this way since I got it, so I can't wholeheartedly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Soylent Green

customer_reviews.title: A little light, a little imprecise but good for the dough.
customer_reviews.text: A good mouse, but feels kind of light. Too imprecise for your serious gamer or photo editor, just a little too much play. But for pretty much everything else? She'll do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: evan a bessette

customer_reviews.title: died after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: The bluetrack technology didn't work well for me at all. I couldn't use it on my wooden floor! Also, the blue light started failing on me and my mouse started acting up even when I was using a mouse pad. It also didn't hold it's charge for more than 2 days before blinking red. Sigh...
customer_reviews.author: Esther

customer_reviews.title: never change batteries again
customer_reviews.text: As long as I remember to park it on it's little charger every night before leaving work, I always have a happy, fully charged mouse to start my workday with. It's a hefty size for a mouse, but has lots of buttons and a pretty blue light.
customer_reviews.author: btagsTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft 2.4 GHz wireless mouse
customer_reviews.text: So far the mouse is working well. It keeps a charge for the entire week and then some and I use my computer at least 5 days out of the week for work. You'll need to set the tracking sensitivity for your needs. Overall I am pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: KDP

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Works on more surfaces than my $75 Logitech Performance mouse although the LP is not as heavy. Very good battery for this unit. My children use it for days on end and forget to charge it but it will still have enough juice left for me to use. Recharge doesn't take long.
customer_reviews.author: DeepDive

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mouse/ergo/comfortable
customer_reviews.text: After using a previous version of the microsoft explorer mouse years ago, I found this one to connect to my custom PC build for my in home studio. I have used the Ergo4000 keyboard for years as well and this is the perfect compliment for that keyboard. 2+ years of use and never once an issue. Has a rechargeable dock that works perfect as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel F. Dixon

customer_reviews.title: beautiful one.
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a couple of mouses, and this is the the best, battery life is very good and holds the life for at least a month plus and charging is simple, less than couple of hrs. I usually leave it over night and don't have to worry about losing charge when working.
customer_reviews.author: Guru H

customer_reviews.title: The perfect mouse, but no longer made - what a shame.
customer_reviews.text: I really wish they still made these in a corded version. As it is, this version is getting harder and harder to find.
customer_reviews.author: Cory0331

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mouse as a replacement for an old wireless mouse I've had for a couple of years.Love the feel of it (the other one was a tad bit small), very smooth to use, very accurate. I'm on a destop running Windows 7 32bit and I just had to download the updated version on the software "intellipoint" so it would run on this OS. All in all great product, definitely recommend it for other users, but I would say it's a bit big if using as a real "travel" mouse with a laptop
customer_reviews.author: DodgyKnees

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: I generally steer clear of wireless mice but this is my second MS wireless mouse and both came with rechargeable batteries and chargers, a big plus. As a mouse it works well, a bit funky shape wise and also the blue light is slightly disconcerting initially.
customer_reviews.author: Efros

customer_reviews.title: Most efficient mouse
customer_reviews.text: I like this mouse a lot cause it fits the hand nice and can be used on ANY surface, the laser is deep to let you use mutiple surfaces, in addition easy charge dock you just set it down on it and it starts charging, so i say if you are looking for a great mouse this ones it cause of all around well made
customer_reviews.author: MGncola

customer_reviews.title: best wireless mouse
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. I can use it with my HTPC from the couch or floor or wherever, and I never have a problem with tracking. It's reliable, comfortable, and the batteries have lasted well so far. My only minor nitpick is that it doesn't have an off switch.
customer_reviews.author: beelyo

customer_reviews.title: May be one of the best mice around
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has a great feel and works on any of the surfaces that I've tried. Range is quite good and I like the recharge station that it comes with. I just have to worry about Microsoft reliability since some of the last few items I've bought recently has failed.
customer_reviews.author: B. Siao

customer_reviews.title: Decent mouse
customer_reviews.text: Mouse is cool looking with the blue lights and works great. The only con is the signal gets interference easily. It says to avoid using it around wires, cables, wireless modems or other wireless devices, and ethernet cables. How is that possible? It is, after all, a computer mouse. I have to have the receiver plugged in on the front of my tower, at the top, or there is too much interference. With the receiever in that position it works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Real smooth.
customer_reviews.text: The MS Explorer mouse works really smooth on any surface I am using it with Windows 7 with no problems. That is, not using the drivers on the disk which causes problems with the scroll wheel not working properly, you have to keep scrolling as fast as you can to get to move the page a couple of lines. I haven't used it with the drivers on Vista so I can't comment on how the scroll will work. This is the lightest and easiest and most comfortable mouse I have used as of today.
customer_reviews.author: Juliusky

customer_reviews.title: Too big, Weak signal, Battery life sucks
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is too big for any hand, not comfortable at all, the laser is not in the middle and that change the way you have to move it, A LOT. Is not accurate for design, the signal is weak, the red light is always blinking, it doesn't seems to fit perfect on the charger and the battery dies if you don't charge it overnight.
customer_reviews.author: Alex G

customer_reviews.title: Very Functional
customer_reviews.text: First experience with wireless devices. It more than exceeded expectations. Some reviews were critical of the un-notched scroll wheel but, in my opinion, the scroll wheel works fine -- just feels a little different. The ergonomics are great and really fits the relax hand/palm well. It does not fit a left handed
customer_reviews.author: F. Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Wireless mouse
customer_reviews.text: A Christmas gift for parents last year and was well received. Although I thought it a bit pricy for just a wireless mouse, it was cheaper than a wireless keyboard/mouse combo. The mouse worked as expected and allowed for configuring personal settings.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R. Salisbury

customer_reviews.title: Great price but needs more juice
customer_reviews.text: I really like the functionality and loved the price. The problem is you are led to believe it will give 1 week of life per charge but in reality, a few days is about it. I really would have preferred to pay $10 more and pack it full of power.
customer_reviews.author: E Summers

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Well, we had a wired mouse before this one so this a 100% improvement. It was very easy to install & set-up. It works great, looks cool & does exactly what it is supposed to do. I disabled the extra buttons on the side, because we never need to use those.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Big, good to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have big hands, and this mouse fits my hands perfectly. Also, the mouse it tough and precise. And the curve makes it easier to operate.
customer_reviews.author: tomatocall

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: It is a full sized mouse. Plug and Play in W7. The charging station is a really nice touch to an already great product. I have found that it works on my wood tables, laminate, and couch. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Zero

customer_reviews.title: This mouse rocks!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is great! Very comfortable to use, very professional appearance; and bonus...it has a charging station! Everybody should have this mouse! Buy it here, at Amazon. It's $20.00-29.00 less expensive!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tried

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse
customer_reviews.text: It's a great mouse. The button location is good with no unintentional bump-clicking, it will track on anything (even my glass-top desk), it seems to go forever before it needs a re-charge with plenty of advanced notice, and i like the size of it. They didn't re-invent the mouse, but they did make a great one.
customer_reviews.author: Matma

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft 2.4ghz wireless bluetrack lazer mouse
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with mouse so far. Tracks well; feels great. The only negative is that you have to recharge the mouse at night. Not very hard to do - just park it in the base. The hard part is to remember to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Mel P

customer_reviews.title: just So So
customer_reviews.text: this mouse only works good on hard flat surfaces. i tried to use it while sitting on my couch but it skips beats when i move it. so i had to buy a mouse pad for my couch lol. Good range and love that it has a charger. works great on hard surfaces and has a cool blue glow sometimes...overall good buy for the price
customer_reviews.author: ahix777

customer_reviews.title: Very nice mouse
customer_reviews.text: I've had trouble with several other mice. They won't read on my wood desk or the signal strength was terrible. I've had zero issues with this mouse so far. Wish I'd bought it sooner. The price on this mouse is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: BamBam

customer_reviews.title: Nice try but not for me
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd give this a try since it's new and supposedly tracks on anything. That may be true but I had trouble with it tracking on a mouse pad! Seems to slow down and "stick" at times. Also as in previous review it is a LOT bigger than it looks. Too wide for my comfort. I like that it is rechargable but I really need smooth operation in both scrolling and movement and it wasn't working well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bitting

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: it's been a couple of years since we purchased this, and it's still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: S. E. Daly

customer_reviews.title: GREAT MOUSE
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse about 6 months ago and so far has been working great re-chargeable battery last about 5-6 weeks with moderate use, probably more Now I'm purchasing another one for a second computer
customer_reviews.author: CAC.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I should have stuck with Logitech. Bought this at the end of January and now it doesn't work. It doesn't light, the computer no longer recognizes it and it doesn't charge. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: whiwo

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mouse to replace my microsoft bluetooth explorer been using it for a month with no complaints. Great battery life last a couple of days and recharges easily with the included cradle, also comes with a AA battery witch can be easily replaced when it no longer holds a charge. Have yet to find a surface that it doesn't work and would definitely recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: u38d

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS MOUSE
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. No problems, battery lasts forever and charges fast. The indicator lights are very helpful without being overwhelmingly bright. Base is flat and keeps out of the way nicely. Will deff buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Chevegan

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great . Was a just what I needed no problem with it.Price was right .Easy to use would buy more if and when I need them.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Ronald Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse
customer_reviews.text: These Blu-track mice are some of the best on the market and really the only ones I like to use. I have not been using the smaller one being it is for my laptop, but the larger version at my desk is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mathis

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse. The connection distance from pc to my sofa on the other side of the room works without a hiccup. The feel of the buttons are good. The charge station is effortless. The price was the best deal on the Internet.
customer_reviews.author: W. TAYLOR

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: We use this mouse in the living room to control the computer on the TV, around a 12 ft. range. We don't have cable. We are very happy with the way it works. Have not had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Holy cow, that's an awesome mouse
customer_reviews.text: I use this mouse as my laptop mouse for work. It is rather big for this purpose but I love me some big mouse. For gaming its a wireless mouse and therefore totally useless, but when they say it tracks on anything, they mean it! I haven't found a substance yet (they say glass but I don't routinely track on glass, so...) that it won't track on. Definitely worth the price Amazon is asking for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jethro Biggums

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this product. Not only is it wireless, but it has a rechargeable base that only requires a 15-minute charge time. The mouse is utilized a long time before it is in need of charging so the down time is little to none. Great buy and the price was right!
customer_reviews.author: cmcc

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty slick and it works great, just over time i got wear marks where my palm sits.
customer_reviews.author: Fred E.

customer_reviews.title: Mouse died in less than 30 days
customer_reviews.text: The mouse worked perfectly for a few weeks and then completely died. No signal, no power, no lights, nothing. The battery is completely charged and I tried following all the steps in the instructions to revive it, but could not. Also, just missed the return window for Amazon. So, in short, a complete waste of money and nothing to be done.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewRP2

customer_reviews.title: Not Too Shabby
customer_reviews.text: At first, I thought this mouse was going to be way to big, it is huge when you first look at it. After actually using it, it is a perfect fit, and accurate as well. One of the best mice I've used so far.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Very Sad :(
customer_reviews.text: I loved this mouse at first and for the price you couldn't beat it! But then, after a month of use it doesn't charge anymore. I guess I'll start putting regular batteries in it but who knows how long they will last. I wouldn't bother with this mouse. Get one that is more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Kandi

customer_reviews.title: Great! For about three months...
customer_reviews.text: As long as I remembered to charge the mouse every night, and as long as I had the USB transmitter plugged into the jack closest to the mouse, this worked great! For three months. I turned on my computer yesterday, and while all the lights were on showing that it had power and was charged, it did nothing. I restarted my computer several times and tried to reinstall the drivers. Nothing worked. I went to try the USB transmitter in a different jack and literally burned my fingers. I'm really disappointed - this was a great mouse (until it wasn't).
customer_reviews.author: E. Pavlica

customer_reviews.title: I bought this mouse thinking blue track would be bad ads but it turned out to be craps not ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse thinking blue track would be bad ads but it turned out to be craps not the sellers fault tho
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Marvelous mouse
customer_reviews.text: Nice design. Fit great in my hand. Holds its charge for weeks. Adaptable to multiple computers. Easily integrated/not necessary to install drivers by download or CD each time it's moved between computers. Never received an error message using this mouse on a home made computer or a manufactured computer.
customer_reviews.author: Envision

customer_reviews.title: Exploere Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Good mouse. Use it for my laptop on the arm of my recliner. My optical mouse seemed to work better. The Explorer mouse is very particular regarding the position it is held. Actually have not tried it on a flat surface, yet.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Missing part
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is pretty much like any other mouse. I bought it used and it did not come with the charging station. Since I only paid about twenty dollars for it I did not want to bother sending it back. I came up with a workaround for the missing docking station and am using it. Even though I bought it used they should have taken more care to see that all the parts were there. Buyer beware I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory G

customer_reviews.title: Good transaction
customer_reviews.text: This was a good transaction and I would recommend it to others. If people are interested in a system such as this they will find this to be a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Elfner

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: responsive; range is decent; precise... would like a silent click mouse (dont we all?) but this is great for the price
customer_reviews.author: M. King

customer_reviews.title: Love this mouse
customer_reviews.text: Works on everything except shiny surfaces just like they say. Holds a charge for a couple of weeks with light home usage and charges overnight. I don't miss the ratcheting wheel at all. Cool blue glowing light!
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Mouse
customer_reviews.text: It's awesome. Because grip performance is wonderful and comfortable. I absolutely recommend. Well, the shippining price is lower than other website. and is very faster.
customer_reviews.author: ermdjoo

customer_reviews.title: Product
customer_reviews.text: The best quality at very good product is what I expected and I do not regret having purchased arrived on time and very happy
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Jose Urdantea VIllasmil

customer_reviews.title: Gary G.
customer_reviews.text: It is very unique and I have no problem with it the battery can be recharged at any time. The product is superb, excellent and hot to the max.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B. Grant

customer_reviews.title: what? why?
customer_reviews.text: everything is fantastic about this mouse. range, reaction, style, blue light; all very cool and very user friendly. buuuuuut... the wireles usb device's casing came off of the silicone chip inside it and it does so every time the piece is removed from the cpu. the piece still works but it is very unsatisfying to pull off the casing, pull the usb/chip out of the usb port and then re-insert the chip into the casing after every use.
customer_reviews.author: stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: The best mouse I have used. It is great and very useful. I find it to work well with my computer.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer johnson

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: got this one used like new, very good battery life, long range feature works very well, biggest mouse I've owned
customer_reviews.author: GIV3

customer_reviews.title: At $20, it's a steal
customer_reviews.text: For the price ($20), you can't go wrong. Works well. Good feel and tracks accurately. Wheel scrolls smoothly. Even looks nice. Yes, a bit plastic-y and not going to survive a throw against a brick wall, but you could do far worse for the money. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve-o

product_meta.title: Microsoft 2.4GHz Wireless BlueTrack Technology Laser Explorer Mouse with 30-Foot Range and Easy Battery Recharging Base (5AA-00001).
product_meta.description:
The Microsoft Explorer Mouse, with revolutionary Microsoft BlueTrack Technology, works more places than ever before, including on granite countertops, living room or airport carpets¿even on a wood table or rough, unfinished park bench.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From the Manufacturer 

 

Overview:Works on Virtually Any Surface. 
The Microsoft® Explorer Mouse, with revolutionary Microsoft BlueTrack™ Technology, works more places than ever before, including on granite countertops, living room or airport carpets—even on a wood table or rough, unfinished park bench.

Features:


Easy Recharging
The battery status indicator tells you when a quick recharge is needed. The compact, stable recharging base is easy to use. Reliable Wireless on the Go
Microsoft 2.4 GHz wireless and the snap-in mini-transceiver deliver a reliable connection with up to a 30-foot range. Sophisticated Design and Comfort
The glowing blue light effects and comfortable curved surfaces set your mouse apart. Additional Features:

 * Go Anywhere - Microsoft BlueTrack Technology™ combines the power of optical with the precision of laser for remarkable tracking on more surfaces.*
 * 5-Button Mouse - Get quick access to the media, programs, and files you use most often with customizable buttons. 
 * 4-Way Scrolling - Scroll side to side as well as up and down.



What is BlueTrack? Microsoft’s proprietary BlueTrack™ Technology works on more surfaces than both optical and laser mice.** It uses high-angle imaging optics to generate an accurate picture of the surface.



Now track more accurately on: 
Granite 
Carpet 
Wood 

System Requirements * Windows Vista®/Windows XP * 100 MB
   
   
 * Mac OS X v10.2.x-10.5x * 30 MB
   
   
 * USB Port
 * CD drive
 * 1 NiMH rechargeable battery (included)

Also Available: 
Microsoft® Explorer Mini Mouse
For Notebooks

 *BlueTrack Technology does not work on clear glass or mirrored surfaces.
**Compared to leading laser and optical mice commercially available spring 2008.
feature_bullets: Easy Charging - The battery status indicator tells you when a quick recharge is needed The compact, stable recharging base is easy to use
Reliable Wireless on the Go - Microsoft 24 GHz wireless and the snap-in mini-transceiver deliver a reliable connection with up to a 30-foot range
Sophisticated Design and Comfort - The glowing blue light effects and comfortable curved surfaces set your mouse apart
Go Anywhere - Microsoft Blue Track Technology combines the power of optical with the precision of laser for remarkable tracking on more surfaces

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars315 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
